column5: Hi all,      JUST GOT BACK FROM OUR PLACE IN FRANCE........................................           A CHANCE TO HANG OUT WITH SOME OLD FRIENDS.........................................                 MAKE SOME NEW ONES..................................................                  CHILLAX A BIT.........................................                 PLAY.........................................                                  EAT GOOD FOOD..........................................                            COLLECT FOSSILS, EXPLORE NEW STUFF, EXAMINE WEIRD CREATURES....................................................                                    AND TAKE IN SOME OF THE  STUNNING ARCHITECTURE ANC SCENERY OF THE DORDOGNE REGION....................................................                                                                     THIS WAS THE CLOSEST I GOT TO FISHING FOR THE 2 WEEKS WE WERE THERE........................................................                       SO THE DAY AFTER WE GOT BACK.....I WAS IN THE BOAT!                                                      WAS A GREAT TIME AWAY.....GOOD TO BE BACK TOO.      TIGHT LINES ALL.
Very very nice Simon! You just impressed the heck out of me. Jack will grow up with a rich past. Just wonderful.
Oh boy, that pile of mussells had me drooling
Hard to beat Europe for great little towns and buildings.
Always enjoyed your pics and vids. Thx for sharing.
Looks like a great trip Simon. I love France. Spent quite a bit of time around Reims myself and enjoyed every minute.  I hear southern France is even nicer. I really need to go back again.
Well no wonder I didn't see you in Dryden. Looks like a great vacation Simon. Life looks good for you!
Some brilliant photos Simon. Looks like a beautiful spot to kick back and relax.
Great pictures!

Thanks Roy, it costs an arm and a leg now Jack is full fare on flights....but he needs to be there to see Gramma and Gramps.    LOL...we ate a lot of mussels!    Yup, history seething through every building it seems, our building has been around since the 1600s....it was an old nunnery to begin with, we have an old stone coffin we use as a flower pot that was unearthed on the grounds when they were ploughing the fields....the skeleton of the 400 year old nun disintegrated when the air hit it....COOOOL!    Thanks Frank.    LOL...i nearly ended up in Reims after taking a wrong turn coming off the ferry at Calais!    Thanks Dan....you know to give me a shout when you are here though right?    I can definitely sleep more than anywhere else when i'm there....a well needed rest!    Thanks Matt!
While looking at your pics,my GF heard me exclaim "WOW" & asked what I was looking at,showed her your post,she said "WOW" Beautiful shots,thx for sharing.
Terrific pictures Simon. Looks like such a beautiful region of France, great picture of Jack in front of that field.  And that walleye looks like a beast in the video, how big was it ?
Wow, is it ever gorgeous there! Must have been hard to leave but those walleye must have made it a little easier.
Fantastic shots Simon, beautiful place you've got on the other side of the "pond".  The architecture and food look amazing.  Those walleyes aren't so bad either.
Awesome report Simon!  Thanks for sharing
Oh, Les moules!!
Just fantastic photos Simon.  I had a sneak peak on Facebook, but there are some new ones here.  Looks like a wonderful place

Simply awesome Simon. The photo of your son in front of the planted field is stunning. I can remember the year you posted fishing pictures after visiting your folks. Little did I know I would still be watching 3 yrs later. Thanks for sharing
majestic- the scenery, the food, the wine - all mahvalous!  - but I didn't realise you had frog in ya?
love that shot of Jack holding the sprig of wheat.That's quite the vacation and an even better return haha
